sentences.sContent: It could be and I believe it will be—the turning point of your life.
sentences.sContent_eng: It could be and I believe it will be—the turning point of your life.
sentences.sCn: 这本书可能是，而且我坚信它会是——你生活中的转折点。

sentences.sContent: Yet, still, it was the turning point in my life - because I was no longer biasing myself against God.
sentences.sContent_eng: Yet, still, it was the turning point in my life - because I was no longer biasing myself against God.
sentences.sCn: 然而，这仍是我人生中的一个转折点，因为从此以后我不再对上帝存有偏见。

sentences.sContent: OpenStreetMaps is itself at a turning point as it tries to progress from a techie-driven project to one that the ordinary consumer can not only understand but contribute to as well.
sentences.sContent_eng: OpenStreetMaps is itself at a turning point as it tries to progress from a techie-driven project to one that the ordinary consumer can not only understand but contribute to as well.
sentences.sCn: “开放式街道地图”自身正处在一个转折点，因为它试图从一个技术驱动的项目发展为普通消费者不仅可以理解也对它作出贡献的项目。

trans.tranOther: the time when an important change starts, especially one that improves the situation
